radiographic_examinations.findings: Abnormal intimal thickening of the thoracic and abdominal aorta, extending into the superior mesenteric artery and the proximal left common iliac artery; liver and spleen normal; no small-bowel dilatation, ascites, free air, or bowel-wall thickening.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up imaging showed resolution of the thickening and enhancement in the aorta four months later.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: MRI scan of the chest and upper abdomen
radiographic_examinations.findings: Diffuse intimal thickening and enhancement in the wall of the thoracic and abdominal aorta; moderate-to-severe narrowing at the origin of the left subclavian artery and mild narrowing at the origins of the celiac and superior mesenteric arteries.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up imaging showed resolution of edema after treatment.
